ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: You get to look at social issues in America through an economics lense, which is a really cool concept in it of itself. A unique niche that I think should be more common at Yale.
The nuances of social issues, beyond the superficial facts everyone knows about

I developed a greater appreciation for the field of economics. Rebecca brought in many guest lecturers that helped highlight the versatility of economics and how it can be used to better our society. I learned how to use R in this class! I really appreciated our unit on the impact of education on social mobility, and how economists are improving the health care system.
I learned how to analyze economic data and apply it to social issues. I learned how to write a literature review in economics.
I really enjoyed this course. I think I gained skills in how to think through economic issues, as well as familiarity with how to engage with research on the topic.
I developed a greater understanding of analyzing social issues related to economic decisions. I got to share my ideas and learn about the economics of health care which I was really interested in.

I learned a lot about the various social issues affecting America and the economic impacts. I also got to reflect a lot more about my own neighborhood and my background and how that impacted my present and will impact my future.
Learned about pressing social issues in our country.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It would be nice if assignments were graded and distributed faster.

It's a seminar, but sometimes felt more like a lecture. At the same time, there is a lot of information to give out, so not sure how to fix that. It was a very good class, and I think that it has potential to be a truly excellent one.

The strengths were the guest lectures and readings, they were very informative and nuanced which is very important when you deal with social issues. A weakness is that sometimes I felt the presentations could have been more engaging rather than lecture focused since its a seminar
The lectures could have been a little more engaging. Overall, it was very strong.

A huge strength is having Rebecca as a prof. She is incredibly accessible and makes a strong effort to connect with each student. She is an invaluable resource, as she is very current on many issues in the field. I also really enjoyed how units were split up by issue area (eg education, criminal justice).
One weakness is I wish more class time had been allocated for whole group discussion.

Strengths: very interesting topics are discussed, the class is able to dive into deep discussions, Rebecca teaches in a very active, hands-on way that encourages you to not just do assignments but actually put your all in them
Weakness: I think we could have had more discussion time and I wish we had a draft submission for our final paper or had a class time to peer review each other

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Econ is actually interesting

I absolutely would! I think it has so much important informationplease don't take it if you're just looking for a gut though, I think this class could be really helpful for people who are truly interested in the topic.
Yes, I think it covers a breadth of topics everyone should know about
Yes. You learn a lot and it is a very interesting class.
Yes absolutely! Its a great class, whether youre planning to be an Econ major or not (I am not).

I would definitely recommend this course because not only are the topics really interesting and insightful but they are taught well to and we have ample time to reflect on serious topics ourselves and with our peers.
Great class. Loved professor and topics. Best Class I took as Freshman.
